column4: Anyone familiar with bind?  I have it working perfectly on my dns server, but I can't seem to get it to resolve for other machines on the network...
and I can ping the machine running bind from the other machines
as root, lsof -i :53
on the dns machine?
yeah - is it actually listening on other than 127.0.0.1?
I got a listing , but I can't tell what ip its listening on
sorry... lsof -ni :53
you just did an install, nothing beyond that?  or did you addzones, etc?
hrm..
resolv.conf on the client points at .3?
I can switch over to a linux client if needed
but your server is running on .2....
when I did the lsof command, it lists named a bunch of times, but there are different users... bind and root... and 4 different pids
does the machine have more than one IP then?
then why should the client expect to get answers from .2 when it sends its requests to .3
it's multithreaded - there is onmly one
ah, ok
I'm one for overkill debugging tools....
we're looking to see if the server is sending a response or not
I think it was just something with my acl for allow-query... I explicitly typed in my client address, and now it works ;-)
ah, ok
